bibl.title: Letter from Lewis B. Bates to Henry Rose Carter, February 23, 1921

div1.p: Bates informs Carter that yellow fever vaccine and serum has been sent.

div1.head: Letter from Lewis B. Bates to Henry Rose Carter, February 23, 1921
div1.opener:
THE PANAMA CANAL
CANAL ZONE
HEALTH DEPARTMENT
Board of Health Laboratory
IN REPLY REFER TO FILE
Ancon, Canal Zone,
February 23, 1921.
Dr. Henry Carter,
c/o Bonzi Banco Mercantil Americano,
Chiclayo, Peru.
Dear Dr. Carter,
div1.p:
The following cable addressed to the Chief Quarantine Office,
Canal Zone, was referred by the Chief Health Officer to this Laboratory
for compliance with request therein contained.

“nybl 97 newyork 36 qf
Chief quarantine officer canalzone panama
ship earliest opportunity to doctor henry carter care bonzi
banco mercantil americano del peru chiclayo peru entire
supply noguchi vaccine and serum shipping you further supply
through medical supply depot.

The first ship sailing for Peru after receipt of above cable
was the “Huasco” sailing on February 23, 1921; on which ship we forwarded
you our entire supply of yellow fever vaccine and serum consisting of:

1 package received September 8, 1921
Lot 8 No. 558 Dated 8/20/20
10 20cc bottles killed culture of Leptospira icteroides.

1 package received November 17, 1920.
Lot 9 Dated 9/17/20.
26 20cc bottles killed cultures of Leptospira icteroides.
9 20cc bottles anti icteroides serum.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, LEWIS B. BATES,
Chief of Laboratory. cc-Chief Health Officer
Rockefeller Foundation, International Health Board,
61 Broadway, New York, N. Y.
